creator: thomas_locher@swissre.com
text:
To lock down an installation I want to remove the write-access to as many 
files and directories as possible, especially though the /conf directory. 
Unfortunately when reading conf files a temporary file is written to the same 
directory. Please use a different structure to allow a complete clampdown of a 
configuration.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Only some configurations need write access. The problem in Tomcat 4.1.x is the
realm, so use the old memory realm to get around that. You can also remove the
admin webapp to improve your startup time (it's useless without write access to
the conf, obviously).
